pullRequest.body:
Now it doesn't require that the discriminant is equal. This is like `Units.ext`.

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ ext`
`+ toWeierstrassCurve_injective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
bors d=@Ruben-VandeVelde

:v: Ruben-VandeVelde can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think this is fine, yeah.

bors merge
~~I think you should type `bors r+`~~

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10888863690/job/30214251644)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10888863690/job/30214252181)
I suggest calling this `toWeierstrassCurve_injective`
Then this is `toWeierstrassCurve_injective.eq_iff.symm`, if you need it. (Do you?)
Good point! Actually I don't need it, though.
Should it be this lemma or just `(h : x.toWeierstrassCurve = y.toWeierstrassCurve)`? In the latter case, you can tell `ext` to stop after this step and argue about bundled `WeierstrassCurve`s.

Currently the `ext` is this one together with `x.Δ' = y.Δ'` (which is not necessary and is removed in this PR). Yours is named as `ext'` (later renamed to `toWeierstrassCurve_injective`) in this PR. I don't know which one is better for the ext lemma, though.

I've checked that
```lean
@[ext]
theorem ext : Function.Injective (toWeierstrassCurve (R := R))
```
works and the later proof using `ext` is not affected. Is this a good idea?
I think the current version is better.
As in: I think the PR is LGTM as it is.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/Weierstrass): change the ext lemma for `EllipticCurve`
